content:
/>
V.iii.12.C.3.b
.
Definition: Parkinsonism
Parkinsonism is a disease process separate and distinct from Parkinson’s disease.  Also called
atypical Parkinson’s disease or Parkinson’s plus
, it is a general term that refers to a group of neurological disorders that cause movement problems similar to those seen in Parkinson’s disease, as discussed in
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, 12.C.3.a
.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 12, Section C - Progressive Neurological Disorders
citation: Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 12, Section C
